com.hcl.domino.security

Interface Acl


  • public interface Acl
    Access Control List of a database including functions to query access
    Author:
    t.b.d

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addEntry(String name, AclLevel accessLevel, List<String> roles, Collection<AclFlag> accessFlags)
      This function adds an entry to an access control list.
      void addRole(String role)
      Adds a role to the ACL.
      String getAdminServer()
      Reads the name of the administration server for the access control list.
      List<AclEntry> getEntries()
      Returns all ACL entries
      Optional<AclEntry> getEntry(String name)
      Convenience method that call getEntries() and returns a single value for the specified name
      List<String> getRoles()
      Returns all roles declared in the ACL
      boolean isUniformAccess()
      Check if "Enforce consistent ACL" is set
      AclAccess lookupAccess(String userName)
      Looks up the access level for a user and his groups
      AclAccess lookupAccess(UserNamesList namesList)
      Looks up the access level for a UserNamesList

      This function deletes an entry from an access control list.
      void removeRole(String role)
      Removes a role from the ACL
      void renameRole(String oldName, String newName)
      Changes the name of a role
      void save()
      This function persists the access control list in the parent database.
      void setAdminServer(String server)
      Change the name of the administration server for the access control list.
      void setUniformAccess(boolean uniformAccess)
      Changes the value for "Enforce consistent ACL"
      void updateEntry(String name, String newName, AclLevel newAccessLevel, List<String> newRoles, Collection<AclFlag> newFlags)
      This function updates an entry in an access control list.

      Unless the user's name is specified to be modified, the information that is not specified to be modified remains intact.

      If the user's name is specified to be modified, the user entry is deleted and a new entry is created.
      Unless the other access control information is specified to be modified as well, the other access control information will be cleared and the user will have No Access to the database.

    • Method Detail

      • lookupAccess

        AclAccess lookupAccess(String userName)
        Looks up the access level for a user and his groups
        Parameters:
        userName - username, either canonical or abbreviated
        Returns:
        acl access info, with access level, flags and roles

      • lookupAccess

        AclAccess lookupAccess(UserNamesList namesList)
        Looks up the access level for a UserNamesList
        Parameters:
        namesList - names list for a user
        Returns:
        acl access info, with access level, flags and roles

      • getRoles

        List<String> getRoles()
        Returns all roles declared in the ACL
        Returns:
        roles

      • getEntries

        List<AclEntry> getEntries()
        Returns all ACL entries
        Returns:
        ACL entries hashed by their username in the order they got returned from the C API

      • getEntry

        Optional<AclEntry> getEntry(String name)
        Convenience method that call getEntries() and returns a single value for the specified name
        Parameters:
        name - name
        Returns:
        an Optional describing the ACL entry, or an empty one if not found

      • addEntry

        void addEntry(String name,
              AclLevel accessLevel,
              List<String> roles,
              Collection<AclFlag> accessFlags)
        This function adds an entry to an access control list.
        Parameters:
        name - user or group to be added, either in abbreviated or canonical format
        accessLevel - Access level (AclLevel), of the entry to be added
        roles - roles to be set for this user
        accessFlags - Access level modifier flags (AclFlag), e.g.: unable to delete documents, unable to create documents, of the entry to be added

      • removeEntry

        void removeEntry(String name)
        This function deletes an entry from an access control list.
        Parameters:
        name - user or group to be deleted, in abbreviated or canonical format

      • updateEntry

        void updateEntry(String name,
                 String newName,
                 AclLevel newAccessLevel,
                 List<String> newRoles,
                 Collection<AclFlag> newFlags)
        This function updates an entry in an access control list.

        Unless the user's name is specified to be modified, the information that is not specified to be modified remains intact.

        If the user's name is specified to be modified, the user entry is deleted and a new entry is created.
        Unless the other access control information is specified to be modified as well, the other access control information will be cleared and the user will have No Access to the database.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the entry to change
        newName - optional new entry name or null
        newAccessLevel - optional new entry access level or null
        newRoles - optional new entry roles or null
        newFlags - optional new acl flags or null

      • addRole

        void addRole(String role)
        Adds a role to the ACL. If the role is already in the ACL, the method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        role - role to add

      • removeRole

        void removeRole(String role)
        Removes a role from the ACL
        Parameters:
        role - role to remove

      • renameRole

        void renameRole(String oldName,
                String newName)
        Changes the name of a role
        Parameters:
        oldName - old role name, either enclosed with [] or not
        newName - new role name, either enclosed with [] or not
        Throws:
        DominoException - if role could not be found

      • setAdminServer

        void setAdminServer(String server)
        Change the name of the administration server for the access control list.
        Parameters:
        server - server, either in abbreviated or canonical format

      • getAdminServer

        String getAdminServer()
        Reads the name of the administration server for the access control list.
        Returns:
        the server-name

      • isUniformAccess

        boolean isUniformAccess()
        Check if "Enforce consistent ACL" is set
        Returns:
        true if set

      • setUniformAccess

        void setUniformAccess(boolean uniformAccess)
        Changes the value for "Enforce consistent ACL"
        Parameters:
        uniformAccess - true to set "Enforce consistent ACL" flag

      • save

        void save()
        This function persists the access control list in the parent database.
